title: Augusta County: Clinton Hatcher to Mary Anna Sibert, September 24, 1861
summary: Clinton Hatcher names one exception to the rule of female inconstancy and reveals his feelings for Mary Sibert. He also comments on camp life, mentions a skirmish with the Yankees, and criticizes prominent Unionist John Minor Botts.
keywords: Battle Description, Camp Life, Medicine/Hospitals, Women, American Civil War
